Detailed Description

Definitions for CTK trace logging routines.

Author:
kinuko@fixstars.com
Any error, debug or informative messages can be displayed via one of either trace macros; trace_log(level, fmt, ...), trace_fatal(fmt, ...), trace_error(fmt, ...), trace_warn(fmt, ...), trace_warn(fmt, ...), trace_info(fmt, ...), trace_debug(fmt, ...) or trace_trace(fmt, ...). All the macros takes variable number of arguments like printf. trace_log is the most primary logging function which is called from other macros internally. It takes log level as the first argument, which can be either one of LOGLEVEL_FATAL, LOGLEVEL_ERROR, LOGLEVEL_WARN, LOGLEVEL_INFO, LOGLEVEL_DEBUG or LOGLEVEL_TRACE. Alternatively you can call one of other convenient macros corresponding to each log level (e.g. trace_error()). The base logging level, which specifies what level of log messages should be shown, can be specified by trace_set_log_level(). The printf callback function which is used for displaying the message can also be set by calling trace_set_log_vprintf() (e.g. to let it call syslog or other external logging faciility).

Typedef Documentation

typedef int(*) vprintf_callback_t(const char *fmt, va_list ap)

A typedef of printf callback function for logging.

Function Documentation

int trace_get_log_level (  ) 

Returns the current log level.

Returns:
the current log level

vprintf_callback_t trace_get_log_vprintf (  ) 

Returns the current vprintf callback.

Returns:
A pointer to the current vprintf callback function.

void trace_set_log_level ( int  level  ) 

Sets the current log level. The level should be either one of LOGLEVEL_FATAL, LOGLEVEL_ERROR, LOGLEVEL_WARN, LOGLEVEL_INFO, LOGLEVEL_DEBUG, or LOGLEVEL_TRACE. The log messages whose level is higher than the current level are shown.

Parameters:
level [in] the current log level to be set

void trace_set_log_vprintf ( vprintf_callback_t  callback  ) 

Sets the vprintf callback which specifies how the trace log messages are displayed. By default the callback points to an internal function which just prints out the message to stderr.

Parameters:
callback [in] the vprintf callback function. The callback should be of vprintf_callback_t type, which is defined as following: int ((*vprintf_callback_t)(const char *fmt, va_list ap))

Variable Documentation

unsigned int trace_log_timestamp

A flag variable which determines whether the logger should print out timestamp or not. (default=1)
